result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin Fred Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melvin Fred Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melvin Fred Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time if imposed.  4 days credit if
probation is revoked.  No Huber allowed.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied. Paid in full.  Balance to be refunded to poster.

No contact with E.S. or A.F.  Defendant is not to go to Salty Toad bar.  Maintain fulltime employment.  Defendant is not to possess any weapons.  No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melvin Fred Jr

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
restitution documents filed by the State

Case called for a sentencing and restitution hearing. Defendant Melvin Fred in court with attorney Nick Martinez.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Martinez makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Victim notification has been done.  
The Court Orders the Following: Count #2.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
90 Days Jail, No Huber allowed  (Credit -  4 days).  
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with E.S. or A.F.
Not to go to the Salty Toad Bar
No Use or Possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Maintain full time employment;
Defendant is not to possess any weapons.
Restitution: Set at $0
COSTS:  $243.00  Bail to be applied.

Restitution hearing at 03-16-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Melvin Fred in court with attorney Nick Martinez.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant pleads guilty to count #2 with the repeater struck.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed outright.  Court schedules a sentencing and restitution hearing.  State to provide the information on or before 2/1/2016.  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
